meanings.definition: The arrangement of windows in a building.
meanings.sent1: The fenestration of the house allowed plenty of natural light to enter.
meanings.sent2: The architect carefully planned the fenestration to maximize the view of the garden.
meanings.sent3: The fenestration of the office building made it look like a giant glass box.
meanings.sent4: Her artistic fenestration of the room transformed it into a bright and airy space.
meanings.sent5: The unique fenestration of the cathedral created a stunning play of light and shadow.

meanings.definition: The process of creating openings in a structure for windows or doors.
meanings.sent1: The fenestration of the new house took longer than expected due to the custom window sizes.
meanings.sent2: Proper fenestration is crucial to ensure good ventilation in a building.
meanings.sent3: The fenestration of the old castle was so intricate that it seemed like a maze of windows.
meanings.sent4: The fenestration of the ancient ruins hinted at the grandeur that once existed within.
meanings.sent5: The precise fenestration of the skyscraper showcased the architect's attention to detail.
